meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>different</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to be different</vocabulary>... and of course, to be different is also <vocabulary>to be wrong</vocabulary> in Japan. Don't be different!
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the reading you learned with the kanji. It's not different at all.
